intro: Webera monosperma, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a strong scent to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing a single seed. Webera monosperma is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
